channel.title: Gilded long sword
channel.description:

item.title: Gilded long sword
item.dc:creator: @man_killerx man_killerx
item.description:
@man_killerx wrote:

Okay, Seeing as you are going to stick with with that method, I will give you some tips on improving the all mighty freehand modeling.

1.) Make sure you are working with squares, Triangles where needed.
2.) Make sure you keep it even, The bottom matching the top, The sides of the square even and flush.
3.) It is not a bad thing to use the mirrioring tool, This is really good to use to ensure even modeling, And even colouring later.
4.) You may thing it is hard to make a hilt freehanding it, But really it is not. Just simply make 4 Squares going up, Then bend them from the side to make the bottom touch the top. Then with the CTRL+J (Join vertex) Join them together. Then mirrior it on the X axis then do the same CTRL+J with the sides of this. After that you will have a 2square long, 8square round object, Do that again then a 4square long, 16square round object. Easy used for a hilt.

Hope these helped.

In the [1.)] So you are not confusing this in the faces/triangles creation part.

[][][][]
[][][][]/ squares along the blade, Then triangle it for the tip. Make sure you join the verticles with CTRL+J Or it will look messed up.

Another BIG mistake I see tons of modelers make is this, In their OBJECT tab. Theres like 100 objects in a sword. Make sure you are joining these together because all you do to a object is done to the one selected. So as an example say I have 2 objects, object 1 being selected (both are set to show). I make a face in object 2 then the face wont show I go to object 1 and theres a hundred faces.

Read full topic
